H0.text: What city, Chile's second largest, suffered an 8.8 earthquake in 2010. Valparaiso

H1.text: What city, Chile's second largest, suffered an 8.8 earthquake in 2010. Antofagasta

H2.text: What city, Chile's second largest, suffered an 8.8 earthquake in 2010. Temuco

H3.text: What city, Chile's second largest, suffered an 8.8 earthquake in 2010. Concepcion

A4.text: According to Chile's Seismological Service, Concepción experienced the strongest shaking at MM IX (Violent).

A5.text: According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS) the cities experiencing the strongest shaking—VIII (Severe) on the Mercalli intensity scale (MM)—were Concepción, Arauco, and Coronel.

A6.text: On February 27, 2010, an 8.8 magnitude earthquake struck the city of Concepción, killing more than 521 people and injuring thousands nationwide.

A7.text: Concepción is the second largest city in Chile by urban area and one of the three major conurbations in the country.
